description: As of March 18,2020 the government of Uganda announced closure of all schools for 30 days effective Friday March 2020.
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)

description: As of March 18,2020 the government of Uganda announced closure of all schools for 30 days effective Friday March 2020.
type_sub_cat: Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)

Update: On 14th April, the govt extended the curfew for 21 days more.

description:
As of March 31,2020 the government of Uganda declared a dusk to dawn curfew; 7:00 pm to 6:30 am for 14 days
Update:On 22nd June, the govt announced that the curfew will continue till further notice since Uganda was registering more Covid-19 cases.

description:
As of 18 March  2020,Uganda restricted travel to 17 virus hit countries including;
 Italy,France,South Korea,China,USA,United Kingdom,Netherlands,Switzerland,Sweden,Belgium,Germany,Spain,Norway,Austria,Malaysia,Pakistan and San Marino
type_sub_cat: Visa extensions (e.g. visa validity extended)
type_text: The government of Uganda restricted travel to 17 virus hit countries
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description:
The government of Uganda announced the closure of Entebbe International Airport effective at 12:00 am March 23,2020,as well as the closure of all land borders.

No Individuals are allowed to enter or depart Uganda by air,land or water except for specific cargo vehicles which must follow strict ministry of health procedures
type_sub_cat: Visa extensions (e.g. visa validity extended)

description: Uganda Government has decided that only a driver per cargo truck will be allowed into the country without a conductor or turn man in the meantime following an increase in coronavirus cases in Uganda.
type_sub_cat: Visa extensions (e.g. visa validity extended)
target_country: Burundi,Democratic Republic of the Congo,Kenya,Rwanda,South Sudan,Tanzania
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Uganda, 9th April: The Ministry of Health asked health professions to join as volunteers in the fight against COVID-19.
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure

description:
Uganda Government has agreed to address the plight of nurses and midwives after they presented a list of their demands which they said must be fulfilled.
personal protective gears are being issued to the nurses and midwives who are on frontline for their safety.
Other issues the ministry is working on are; the training of nurses and midwives on Covid-19 case management, inclusion of nurses and midwives in research teams and their representation on various taskforce sub committees
type_sub_cat: Other Health Infrastructure

description: In Uganda , as from 31 March, the President Yoweri Kaguta Museveni has ordered a 2 week lockdown."" Given its spread methods? sneezing and coughing by an inconsiderate and careless person in a cluster of people bundled together as well as individuals own carelessness touching the soft parts of your body without washing your hands or sanitizing them first after careful study we therefore adapted the strategy of dispersing any concentration that may provide fuel to the virus.""
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Uganda, 28th April: The ministry of health appealed to the citizens to stay at home.
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)

description: Uganda (March 2020) has formed a National Task Force, headed by the Prime Minister, to plan and respond to the Covid-19 pandemic.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

description:
As of 3 April 2020,the Ugandan ministry of internal affairs announced for all foreign residents and visitors that any fines accruing from an illegal stay in Uganda from March 18 to May 17,2020 have been waived.

Foreign  residents and visitors with expired immigration status can freely access services in the country without threat of being arrested.
type_sub_cat: NA
type_text: Since the ministry of internal affairs scaled down its operation's and suspended some services effective 18 March 2020,this affected foreign residents and visitors whose immigration status has expired.

description: The Ugandan Ministry of Health shared measures on February 22, 2020, to be practiced by residents of Uganda so as to prevent spread of Covid-19.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: Uganda, April 2020: The ministry of Health released a detailed document clarifying types of quarantine, who should quarantine, how to decide where to quarantine etc.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: Uganda, 23rd April: The Ministry of Health released a detailed document for health workers with protocols to follow, diagnosis, treatment of COVID-19 patients.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: Uganda, 25th April. The Ministry of Health conducted a three-day online survey to identify the main channels of access to information by the public; assess knowledge and perceived risk and risk related behaviour regarding COVID-19. The results of the survey were presented in a report in May which provided recommendations to the government.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: Uganda, 28th May: The Ministry of Health with support from CTI-Africa have developed and launched a mobile app, ""Call the Clinic"" that shall be used to help in curbing the spread of COVID 19 by having time data visualization and analysis using digital maps. The application will facilitate remote patient diagnosis and instant MOH notifications.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: As of March 7,2020 the Ministry of Health  imposed self- quarantine requirements for asymptomatic travelers and in- hospital isolation requirement for all symptomatic travelers arriving in Uganda after recent stays( within 14) days of arrival.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description:
Uganda, 31st March:
Private vehicles were banned from roads.
Closure of all shopping malls,Arcades,hardware shops,business selling non food items,saloons,lodges and garages for 14 days was declared mandatory.
type_sub_cat: All or unspecified non-essential businesses

description: As of 18 March 2020 the Uganda government banned all public gatherings, including worship,pubs,weddings,music shows,rallies and cultural meetings have been suspended for 32 days.
type_sub_cat: Postponement of a recreational or commercial event

description: Uganda, 29th March 2020: The Government has appealed to the citizens to follow social distancing and maintain a distance of at least 2 meters.
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart

description: Uganda, 29th March 2020: The Government has appealed to the citizens to follow social distancing and maintain a distance of at least 2 meters.
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere

description:
Uganda government has pardoned 833 prisoners across the country, a move government officials, say would decongest the prison facilities.
The prisoners are part of the list of more than 1,000 names submitted by the prisons authorities to decongest prisons as the country fights the Cocid-19 pandemic.
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart
